sourceDesc.p:
Replaces extract in Pilgrim Letters 12, p. 599.
MS: Peter Lowens. Ending of letter in CD's hand; the remainder in another hand.

dateline.date: between Dec 1845 and Feb 1846, when CD was actively involved in running the Daily News.

body.p: It is very painful to me to say that I am quite powerless to assist you. No such situation as you require is vacant in the establishment connected with the new Morning Paper:The Daily News. every kind of office attached to it, is already filled and applications similar to yours are so numerous that I have scarcely time to answer or even count them.

I have left your manuscript under cover for you at my house.CD was living at 1 Devonshire Terrace, Regent's Park. After what I have said I am sure you will not expect that I should give you any opinion on it, having so little leisure for my own affairs.

closer.salute:
I am Sir
Your faithful Servant
